tools.name: get_submissions
tools.description:
Retrieve submissions from a Clappia app with optional filtering.

Supports complex filtering with conditions, operators, and logical combinations.
Fetch app definition first to see the fields and statuses in the app.

key.title: Key
key.description: Field key to filter on, use $submissionId, $owner, $status, $lastUpdatedAt, $lastModifiedAt, $createdAt, $updatedAt, $state for standard fields or the field name for custom fields

operator.title: Operator
operator.description: Filter operator to apply, possible values are CONTAINS, NOT_IN, EQ, NEQ, EMPTY, NON_EMPTY, STARTS_WITH, BETWEEN, GT, LT, GTE, LTE, ENDS_WITH

tools.name: add_section
tools.description:
Adds a new section to a Clappia application at a specified position.

Args:
    request (UpsertSectionRequest): The request object containing section details and the position
                                    where the section should be added.

Returns:
    UpsertSectionOperationResponse: The response object indicating the result of the add section operation.

Raises:
    Exception: Propagates any exceptions raised by `app_definition_client.add_section`.

display_condition.description: Display condition for the section, supports multiple arithmetic operations (SUM, DIFF, PRODUCT, LOG...), logical operations (IF/ELSE, AND, OR, XOR, ...), string operations (CONCATENATE, LEN, TRIM, ...) and DATE/TIME operations (TODAY, NOW, DATEDIF, FORMAT) that are supported by Microsoft Excel. Example: {field_name} <> 'value' or {field_name} > 10

tools.name: add_field
tools.description:
Adds a field to a Clappia app. The field type is determined by the request object type.

Args:
    app_id (str): The unique identifier of the Clappia application.
    section_index (int): The index of the section where the field will be added.
    field_index (int): The index position where the field will be placed.
    page_index (int): The index of the page where the field will be added.
    field_name (str): The name of the field.
    request (FieldRequestUnion): The request object containing field configuration. The field type is determined by the specific request type.
    version_variable_name (Optional[str]): The variable name representing the app version. If not specified, the live version is used.
Returns:
    FieldOperationResponse: The response object containing the result of the field addition.

Raises:
    Exception: Any error raised by the underlying field addition method.

dependency_field_names.description:
Names of parent fields that control which radio options are shown.
Must be listed in dependency order (root parent first).

How filtering works:
 User selects 'Clothing' in Category field
 Only radio options starting with 'Clothing||' become available
 User selects 'Shirt' in Type field
 Only options starting with 'Clothing||Shirt||' are shown

Examples:
 Single dependency: ['category_field']
 Multi-level: ['category_field', 'subcategory_field']

List of dropdown options. For dependent dropdowns, use '||' to separate hierarchy levels.

Examples:
 Simple dropdown: ['Red', 'Blue', 'Green']
 Dependent dropdown: ['Shirt||Formal', 'Shirt||Casual', 'T-Shirt||Round Neck']
 Three-level: ['Shirt||Formal||S', 'Shirt||Formal||M', 'T-Shirt||V-Neck||L']

dependency_field_names.title: Dependency Field Names
dependency_field_names.description:
Names of parent dropdown fields that control which options are shown in this dropdown.
Must be listed in dependency order (root parent first).

How filtering works:
 User selects 'Shirt' in Category field
 Only options starting with 'Shirt||' are shown in dependent Type field
 User selects 'Formal' in Type field
 Only options starting with 'Shirt||Formal||' are shown in dependent Size field

Examples:
 Two-level: ['category_field'] - depends on one parent
 Three-level: ['category_field', 'type_field'] - depends on two parents in order

tools.name: update_field
tools.description:
Updates a field in a Clappia app. The field type is determined by the request object type.

Args:
    app_id (str): The unique identifier of the Clappia application.
    field_name (str): The name of the field.
    request (FieldRequestUnion): The request object containing updated field configuration. The field type is determined by the specific request type.
    version_variable_name (Optional[str]): The variable name representing the app version. If not specified, the live version is used.
Returns:
    FieldOperationResponse: The response object containing the result of the field update.

Raises:
    Exception: Any error raised by the underlying field update method.

tools.name: reorder_field

    target_page_index (int): The index of the page where the field should be moved.
    source_section_index (int): The index of the section where the field is currently located.
    target_section_index (int): The index of the section where the field should be moved.

tools.name: get_app_workflow
tools.description:
Retrieve the workflow configuration for a Clappia app.

Args:
    app_id (str): The unique identifier of the Clappia application.
    trigger_type (str): The trigger type of the workflow. allowed values are newSubmission, editSubmission, reviewSubmission. allowed values are newSubmission, editSubmission, reviewSubmission.
    version_variable_name (Optional[str]): The variable name representing the app version. If not specified, the live version is used.
Returns:
    WorkflowResponse: The response object containing the workflow configuration.

tools.name: add_workflow_step
tools.description:
Adds a workflow step to a Clappia app's workflow. The step type is determined by the request object type.

Args:
    app_id (str): The unique identifier of the Clappia application.
    trigger_type (str): The trigger type of the workflow. allowed values are newSubmission, editSubmission, reviewSubmission.
    request (WorkflowStepRequestUnion): The request object containing step configuration. The step type is determined by the specific request type.
    step_variable_name (Optional[str]): The variable name of the step, if not provided, a random variable name will be generated.
    parent_step_variable_name (Optional[str]): The variable name of the parent step, below which the new step will be added. If not provided, the new step will be added to the start of the workflow, else it will be added below the parent step.
    version_variable_name (Optional[str]): The variable name representing the app version. If not specified, the live version is used.
Returns:
    WorkflowStepResponse: The response object containing the result of the step addition.

Raises:
    Exception: Any error raised by the underlying step addition method.

UpsertAiWorkflowStepRequest.description:
Request model for configuring an AI workflow step.

This request defines the instructions, model, and provider to be used
for AI-based processing within a workflow step.

**Allowed LLM Providers and Models:**
- OpenAI:
    - gpt-4
    - gpt-4o
    - gpt-4o-mini
    - gpt-4-turbo-preview
    - o1-mini
    - o1-preview
    - gpt-3.5-turbo
- Claude:
    - claude-2
    - claude-2.1
    - claude-3-haiku-20240307
    - claude-3-sonnet-20240229
    - claude-3-opus-latest
    - claude-3-5-sonnet-latest
    - claude-3-5-haiku-latest
    - claude-3-7-sonnet-latest
- Gemini:
    - gemini-2.0-flash
    - gemini-2.0-flash-lite
    - gemini-1.5-flash
    - gemini-1.5-flash-8b
    - gemini-1.5-pro

Updates a workflow step in a Clappia app's workflow. The step type is determined by the request object type.

Args:
    app_id (str): The unique identifier of the Clappia application.
    trigger_type (str): The trigger type of the workflow. allowed values are newSubmission, editSubmission, reviewSubmission.

Returns:
    WorkflowStepResponse: The response object containing the result of the step update.

Raises:
    Exception: Any error raised by the underlying step update method.

condition.description: Filter condition defining the field, operator, and values to filter by. Validation rules: Field must exist in app definition or be a reserved field. Field type must be searchable. Operator must be compatible with field type. Values must match field type requirements. Date BETWEEN operations require dateToken. Selection field values must match field options. Numeric field values must be valid numbers. Text field values must be non-empty strings. App-related field values must be string IDs. Reserved fields ($submissionId, $status, $createdAt, $updatedAt) have specific validation rules.

logical_operator.title: Logical Operator
logical_operator.description: Logical operator to combine with other filters. Default: 'AND'. Used when multiple filters are applied to the same chart. Example: 'AND', 'OR'

condition_field_name.title: Condition Field Name
condition_field_name.description: Name of the field to filter on. Can be a custom field or reserved field. Reserved fields: $submissionId, $status, $createdAt, $updatedAt, $owners, $all_fields. Example: 'customerName', '$status', '$createdAt'

condition_field_values.title: Condition Field Values
condition_field_values.description: Array of values to filter by. Not required for EMPTY/NON_EMPTY operators. For BETWEEN date operations, requires exactly 2 values (start and end date). For selection fields, values must match field options. For numeric fields, values must be valid numbers. For text fields, values must be non-empty strings. For app-related fields, values must be string IDs. Example: ['John', 'Jane'], [100, 200], ['2024-01-01', '2024-12-31']

condition_field_operator.title: Condition Field Operator
condition_field_operator.description: Operator to apply to the field. Text fields support: CONTAINS, NOT_IN, STARTS_WITH, EQ, NEQ, EMPTY, NON_EMPTY. Numeric fields support: CONTAINS, NOT_IN, EQ, NEQ, GT, GTE, LT, LTE, EMPTY, NON_EMPTY, STARTS_WITH. Date fields support: BETWEEN, EMPTY, NON_EMPTY. Selection fields support: EQ, NEQ, EMPTY, NON_EMPTY. Example: 'CONTAINS', 'EQ', 'BETWEEN', 'EMPTY'

condition_field_date_token.title: Condition Field Date Token
condition_field_date_token.description: Date token for date field filtering. Only valid for date fields with BETWEEN operator. Required for date BETWEEN operations. CUS = Custom date range, TOD = Today, YES = Yesterday. Example: 'CUS', 'TOD', 'YES'

aggregation_type.title: Aggregation Type
aggregation_type.description: Type of aggregation to perform on the data. Example: 'count', 'sum', 'average', 'minimum', 'maximum', 'unique'

aggregation_field.description: Field to aggregate on. Defines which field the aggregation will be performed on.

dimension_label.title: Dimension Label
dimension_label.description: Display label for the dimension. Example: 'Category', 'Region', 'Date Range'

dimension_interval.title: Dimension Interval
dimension_interval.description: Interval for date-based dimensions. Only applicable for date fields. Example: 'day', 'week', 'month', 'year'

dimension_sort_type.title: Dimension Sort Type
dimension_sort_type.description: Type of sorting to apply to dimension values. Example: 'number', 'string'

dimension_field_name.title: Dimension Field Name
dimension_field_name.description: Name of the field to use as dimension. Can be a custom field or standard field. Example: 'category', 'region', 'date', 'status'

dimension_missing_value.title: Dimension Missing Value
dimension_missing_value.description: Value to use when dimension field data is missing. Example: 'Unknown', 'N/A'

dimension_sort_direction.title: Dimension Sort Direction
dimension_sort_direction.description: Sort direction for the dimension values. Example: 'asc', 'desc'

tools.name: update_chart
tools.description:
Updates a chart in a Clappia app's analytics dashboard. The chart type is determined by the request object type.

Args:
    app_id (str): The unique identifier of the Clappia application.
    chart_index (int): The index of the chart to update.
    request (ChartDefinitionRequestUnion): The request object containing chart configuration. The chart type is determined by the specific request type.
    version_variable_name (Optional[str]): The variable name representing the app version. If not specified, the live version is used.

Returns:
    ChartResponse: The response object containing the result of the chart update.

Raises:
    Exception: Any error raised by the underlying chart update method.

tools.name: reorder_chart
tools.description:
Reorder charts in a Clappia app's analytics dashboard.

Args:
    app_id (str): The unique identifier of the Clappia application.
    source_index (int): The current index of the chart to move.
    target_index (int): The target index where the chart should be moved.
    version_variable_name (Optional[str]): The variable name representing the app version. If not specified, the live version is used.

tools.name: get_app_charts
tools.description:
Get all charts for a Clappia app's analytics dashboard.

Args:
    app_id (str): The unique identifier of the Clappia application.
    version_variable_name (Optional[str]): The variable name representing the app version. If not specified, the live version is used.

tools.name: add_user_to_workplace
tools.description:
Add a new user to the Clappia workplace.

Supports adding users with email or phone number, along with optional group assignments
and custom attributes. Only one contact method (email or phone) is required.

tools.name: update_workplace_user_details
tools.description:
Update workplace user details in Clappia.

Allows modification of user information including first name, last name, email address,
and phone number. Only one contact method (email or phone) is required for identification.

tools.name: update_workplace_user_attributes
tools.description:
Update workplace user attributes in Clappia.

Modifies custom attributes associated with a workplace user. Only one contact method
(email or phone) is required for identification.

tools.name: update_workplace_user_role
tools.description:
Update workplace user role in Clappia.

Changes the role of a workplace user. Only one contact method (email or phone) is required
for identification. Supports various role types including Workplace Manager, App Builder, User.

tools.name: update_workplace_user_groups
tools.description:
Update workplace user groups in Clappia.

Modifies the group assignments for a workplace user. Only one contact method (email or phone)
is required for identification. Groups help organize and manage user access.

tools.name: add_user_to_app
tools.description:
Add a user to a specific Clappia app with permissions.

Grants app access to a workplace user with specific permissions. Only one contact method
(email or phone) is required for identification. Supports various permission types.

outputSchema.title: AppUserResponse
outputSchema.description: Response model for app user operations

tools.name: get_workplace_apps
tools.description:
Get all apps available in the Clappia workplace.

Retrieves a list of all apps that exist in the workplace, including metadata
such as app ID, name, creation date, and last update information.

tools.name: get_workplace_user_apps
tools.description:
Get apps accessible to a specific workplace user.

Retrieves the list of apps that a particular user has access to. Only one contact method
(email or phone) is required for identification.

tools.name: get_workplace_users
tools.description:
Get workplace users with pagination support.

Retrieves a paginated list of all users in the workplace. Supports pagination
with page size and token parameters for efficient data retrieval.

is_admin.title: Is Admin
is_admin.description: Whether the user is an admin

can_create_apps.title: Can Create Apps
can_create_apps.description: Whether the user can create apps

outputSchema.title: WorkplaceUsersResponse
outputSchema.description: Response model for workplace users operations
